segment.source: Creating an Enterprise Environment for Compatibility Testing (Windows 10)
segment.target: Creating an Enterprise Environment for Compatibility Testing (Windows 10)

segment.source: The goal of the test environment is to model the operating system that you want to deploy and assess compatibility before deploying the operating system to your production environment.
segment.target: The goal of the test environment is to model the operating system that you want to deploy and assess compatibility before deploying the operating system to your production environment.

segment.source: Creating an Enterprise Environment for Compatibility Testing
segment.target: Creating an Enterprise Environment for Compatibility Testing

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: The goal of the test environment is to model the operating system that you want to deploy and assess compatibility before deploying the operating system to your production environment.
segment.target: The goal of the test environment is to model the operating system that you want to deploy and assess compatibility before deploying the operating system to your production environment.

segment.source: Your test environment is composed of computers on which the new operating system is installed.
segment.target: Your test environment is composed of computers on which the new operating system is installed.

segment.source: Your test environment can be a long-term investment.
segment.target: Your test environment can be a long-term investment.

segment.source: Consider retaining the test environment after deployment to assist in future deployment projects.
segment.target: Consider retaining the test environment after deployment to assist in future deployment projects.

segment.source: Modeling the Production Environment
segment.target: Modeling the Production Environment

segment.source: We recommend the following practices for setting up your test environment:
segment.target: We recommend the following practices for setting up your test environment:

segment.source: Physically separate your test environment from your production environment.
segment.target: Physically separate your test environment from your production environment.

segment.source: Physical separation helps ensure that activity in the test environment does not affect the production environment.
segment.target: Physical separation helps ensure that activity in the test environment does not affect the production environment.

segment.source: On the computers in your test environment, install the new operating system.
segment.target: On the computers in your test environment, install the new operating system.

segment.source: Perform all of your tests by using accounts that have similar permissions to the accounts in your production environment.
segment.target: Perform all of your tests by using accounts that have similar permissions to the accounts in your production environment.

segment.source: This approach helps to ensure that you can determine potential security issues.
segment.target: This approach helps to ensure that you can determine potential security issues.

segment.source: Configuring the Test Environment for Automated Testing
segment.target: Configuring the Test Environment for Automated Testing

segment.source: Typically, tests are run more than once, which requires being able to revert your test environment to a previous state.
segment.target: Typically, tests are run more than once, which requires being able to revert your test environment to a previous state.

segment.source: We recommend the following practices to ensure consistency in testing and consistency in restoring the state of your test environment:
segment.target: We recommend the following practices to ensure consistency in testing and consistency in restoring the state of your test environment:

segment.source: Use disk-imaging software to create physical disk images.
segment.target: Use disk-imaging software to create physical disk images.

segment.source: Use software virtualization features to reverse changes to virtualized hard disks.
segment.target: Use software virtualization features to reverse changes to virtualized hard disks.

segment.source: Determining When Virtualization Is Appropriate
segment.target: Determining When Virtualization Is Appropriate

segment.source: The following table shows some of the advantages and disadvantages of virtualization.
segment.target: The following table shows some of the advantages and disadvantages of virtualization.

segment.source: Advantages
segment.target: Advantages

segment.source: Disadvantages
segment.target: Disadvantages

segment.source: Supports a large number of servers in a limited amount of physical space.
segment.target: Supports a large number of servers in a limited amount of physical space.

segment.source: You can run as many virtual servers as the physical computer’s resources allow.
segment.target: You can run as many virtual servers as the physical computer’s resources allow.

segment.source: Easily shares your test environment between teams.
segment.target: Easily shares your test environment between teams.

segment.source: For example, your test team can create a virtualized test environment and then provide a copy to your development team for use in its development processes.
segment.target: For example, your test team can create a virtualized test environment and then provide a copy to your development team for use in its development processes.

segment.source: Supports multiple users performing simultaneous testing, mimicking the ability for each user to have a dedicated test environment.
segment.target: Supports multiple users performing simultaneous testing, mimicking the ability for each user to have a dedicated test environment.

segment.source: Easily restores your environment to a previous state.
segment.target: Easily restores your environment to a previous state.

segment.source: For example, you can revert to a previous state by using the Undo Disks option.
segment.target: For example, you can revert to a previous state by using the Undo Disks option.

segment.source: May reduce performance.
segment.target: May reduce performance.

segment.source: Virtualized servers may be slower than their physical counterparts.
segment.target: Virtualized servers may be slower than their physical counterparts.

segment.source: The performance of virtualized servers is reduced because physical resources such as disks are virtualized.
segment.target: The performance of virtualized servers is reduced because physical resources such as disks are virtualized.

segment.source: May not support all applications and device drivers.
segment.target: May not support all applications and device drivers.

segment.source: Some hardware-specific device drivers and applications are not supported in virtualized servers.
segment.target: Some hardware-specific device drivers and applications are not supported in virtualized servers.

segment.source: Testing Methodology
segment.target: Testing Methodology

segment.source: When testing an application in a new operating system, we recommend the following methods:
segment.target: When testing an application in a new operating system, we recommend the following methods:

segment.source: Retain the default security-feature selections.
segment.target: Retain the default security-feature selections.

segment.source: Use test automation tools to run your test cases in a consistent, reproducible way.
segment.target: Use test automation tools to run your test cases in a consistent, reproducible way.

segment.source: Use your application in the same way that you use it in your production environment.
segment.target: Use your application in the same way that you use it in your production environment.

segment.source: Use the Compatibility Monitor tool in the runtime-analysis package to gather compatibility feedback.
segment.target: Use the Compatibility Monitor tool in the runtime-analysis package to gather compatibility feedback.

segment.source: Send and receive compatibility data to obtain data and solutions through the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.
segment.target: Send and receive compatibility data to obtain data and solutions through the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.

segment.source: When testing a website or a web application, include both intranet and extranet sites, prioritizing the list based on how critical the site or the application is to your organization.
segment.target: When testing a website or a web application, include both intranet and extranet sites, prioritizing the list based on how critical the site or the application is to your organization.
